fields.summary: Remove all unnecessary gliffy installations

fields.description:
PR:
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-content-formatting-plugin/pull-requests/20/overview

Context: 
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-content-formatting-plugin/pull-requests/10/overview?commentId=474059
fields.summary: Register wiki markup versions of the content formatting macros

fields.description: We will be going connect week this July.  One of the enhancements we would like to do in our add-on is integrate our macros with inline commenting, as can presently be done with images and page text.  Could the REST API for posting and displaying inline comments be opened up to third party add-ons as an experimental feature so that users can work with commenting through our macros?
fields.summary: Opening inline commenting to connect add-ons
Create iframe according to the rendering method specified in context

fields.description:
After speaking to Ben, we agreed the following enhancements are required: 

* Want to be able to see free add-ons
** Total number of instances
** Percentage above bar 
* New screen for add-ons
** Installs over time cumulative
** Summary 
*** Rating for latest, Rating average
*** Ranking 
***** Overall
**** In category
  * Related add-ons
  * Other add-ons by the same vendor
* Vendor screen
  * Server add-ons vs Cloud add-ons
  * More links.
fields.summary: Ecosystem Dashboard: Enhancements
Migrate 100 Bob Swift instances to Connect
Write a blog post announcing CPFA feature
Allow Connect Spring Boot to verify query hash from request payload

fields.description: Here you can find the link to the [link 2.2.28 release of Balsamiq Mockups for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.balsamiq.confluence.plugins.mockups/version/2228]
fields.summary: Upgrade Balsamiq Mockups for Confluence Cloud to 2.2.28
Update Macro REST resources to use MacroId
Support hidden macro body for macros with placeholders
Allow create content properties in metadata with key omitted

fields.description: The copy page tree api is part of the /experiment API and needs to be promoted to official API.
fields.summary: Move "Copy Page Tree API" out of /experimental

fields.description: Average out all the page rank/usefulness inputs and store as a property on the page.
fields.summary: Store page rank as content property
Summary Macro

fields.description: The static and dynamic Confluence Macros that are provided by Atlassian Connect have autocomplete fields. If we spot that a user has pasted a URL into their confluence instance, that does not get autocompleted, but there is one or more Atlassian Connect addons that could autocomplete that URL for them that they could install then we should suggest to the user that they go and install that addon from the UPM.
fields.summary: Automatic Confluence Macro suggestions.
Balsamiq for Confluence Cloud update

fields.description:
Hello,
I tried to edit the soy template "mention-email-notification-2.0.0.soy" in the Confluence web application folder /confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/confluence-mentions-plugin-1.9.23.jar
so that no more content in the notification e-mail is sent.
It would be best if you only received the sentence "you were mentioned in a comment" by e-mail.
Unfortunately, every time I edit the Soy Template, I get the error:
SoyException: Unable to compile Soy templates at: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mentions-plugin:mention-notification-template-body
Anyone know how to edit the template properly?
Thanks
fields.summary: Confluence E-Mail Notification Soy Template

fields.description:
Flaky in pretty much every {{atlassian-connect}} build, e.g. [CONNECT-ACD-670|https://ecosystem-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONNECT-ACD-CITJC-670/artifact] ([artifacts|https://ecosystem-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/build/result/artifactUrlRedirect.action?planKey=CONNECT-ACD-CITJC&buildNumber=670&artifactName=HTML%20dumps%20and%20screenshots&tag=it.confluence.jsapi.TestNavigatorContext/]).

See screenshot.
fields.summary: Fix flaky integration test TestNavigatorContext#testGetCurrentContextOfViewPage()
Vendor Communication Phase 1

fields.description:
Right now, when people PDF export pages, they get nothing from dynamic macros because the content is loaded asynchronously :( 

Here's a suggestion: 
* Add flag {{pdfExport}} in the descriptor
* Use the same URL provided and invoke it the same way it's done with {{staticContentMacros}} but pass a flag or header 

As a add-on developer, I'd set the {{pdfExport}} flag to true, and handle the request accordingly (i.e. plain HTML)
fields.summary: Dynamic content macros do not get included in PDF exports

fields.description:
Currently, we send a non-existent hash {{d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e}} (the hash of the empty string) to the add-on when a new macro is created. Trying to resolve this hash results in a 404.

If there is no body yet, we should not send a hash to the add-on.

If you are previewing a macro, the body should be available to the addon.

Moved to unbundling app fire epic
fields.summary: Improve Macro Preview Handling on 'Insert Macro'

fields.description: When use starts to create a blueprint, it would be very useful if it is possible that on clicking the 'Create' button the user gets dropped straight into the connect plugin (instead of forcing users to go to the edit page).
fields.summary: Connect: allow connect plugin to take user straight to the plugin from blueprint
Bump ACJS version to contain emitToAll feature

fields.description:
* Move the add-on from Kate's Bitbucket account to the Atlassian account
* Set up Bitbucket pipelines builds
* Set up any repo settings required for SOX compliance
fields.summary: Set up builds for link pastes add-on

fields.description:
Spec the single page copy API.

Should include
* Example calls
* Detail how to resolve when
** the page exists
** the page doesn't exist
* What will happen if the space has different permissions?
* Will the ownership of the new page (the copier or the original author)
* Will attachments/permissions/history be copied?

And anything else that is relevant.
fields.summary: Spec: Single Page Copy

fields.description:
* Add an extension point that will show up for each attachment (on the attachment list page)
* Add an API or some way to pass the attachment context to this extension point or to the link target.

This would allow add ons to provide actions against attachments.
fields.summary: Attachment action extension point

fields.description:
Hi,

Attached is an event listener I'd like to register with our confluence server so that when a new page gets created a label automatically gets assigned to it.

Questions:
1) Where on the server does the atlassian-plugin.xml reside?

2) Where on the server do I place the attached event listening code?

I've tried reading up on the subject in your KB but am still at a loss on how to register my listener; so some simple steps on how to do this would be appreciated. 

My main source of reference has been:
https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-plugin-guide/confluence-plugin-module-types/event-listener-module/writing-an-event-listener-plugin-module

Thank you,
Jamie
fields.summary: Help with registering a confluence server event listener

fields.description:
The SPA change will have following impact on custom content:
* Space sidebar items will be displayed inside a tab. It impacts vendor's design because vendor is likely to have their own header. It is not a problem for now but will become a problem when SPA releases in future.
!connect-addons.gif! 
* Since the action is now placed inside an iframe. We need to test and make sure the navigator still works

There is a known issue when in viewing custom content, refresh browser windows will yield page not found error.  This is currently fixing by this story CONFDEV-46421, and it is not part of the check of this story.
fields.summary: Verify custom content integration with SPA
Check for sketchy autoconvert matcher definitions

Add ConnectAddonsInstalledCondition to the autoconvert webresources definition so they don't get downloaded if no Connect Addons are installed.

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACDEV-1834

fields.description:
Following on from the spike : https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-684 we should implement the event topics for macro to macro communication

https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CE/Spike%3A+Rendering+Chart+macro+with+data+source+from+dynamic+connect+add-on
fields.summary: Events for macro to macro communication

fields.description:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/atlassian-connect-dev/TFqf6kSKpjc

Some add-ons providing a custom macro editor need to retrieve internal data specific to the page. For this they need the "content.id" context variable.

You can get the current page if you're in JS: it should be in the meta data tags on the page.
{quote}
<meta name="ajs-page-id" content="294915">
{quote}

But if you're in the server you're currently out of luck: we are going to have to pass it to the add-on.
fields.summary: Provide content.id to custom macro editor

fields.description:
It would be great to have support for extractions in the content byline item to extract the name, icon, etc. from the content property.

As shown in this post https://developer.atlassian.com/confcloud/lesson-2-dynamically-update-your-byline-40514317.html the 'visual' data is stored in a different content property.

It is rather complex to build to use two properties and handle possible conflicts. Instead the possibility to use a single property with extractions would be nice.
fields.summary: Extractions for content byline item content property

fields.description:
There are some data inconsistencies between the Ecosystem Dashboard and GoodData. Ideally, we want one source of truth/consistent data which allows for the following insights: 
* Diversity of our ecosystem:
** How many Connect-Addons are installed.
** How many are installed in each marketplace category (?).
** How many new add-ons have been developed on a month-by-month basis. 
* Bookings being made:
** How many units are being sold on a monthly (?) basis.
** How many units have been sold overall.
fields.summary: Investigate the Confluence Ecosystem Dashboard

fields.description:
A macro can supply a custom editor.  This url doesn't appear to accept variables like the url for the macro itself.

The url that doesn't accept variables:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/modules/fragment/macro-editor.html#url
fields.summary: URL for macro editor doesnt take variables
Core and platform related issues

fields.description:
Connect doc:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/macro-editor.html

When I declare a custom edit dialog, it's always displayed when the user wants to insert my macro instance. How to skip it on macro insertion? I only want to display it on macro edit.
fields.summary: Skip custom edit dialog on macro insertion

fields.description:
The simple blueprint case is one where a connect addon can:

* Add an entry to the create content dialog (ie a blueprint)
* Create content based on a template supplied by the addon
* Call back to confluence to collect context to create or render the template

It does not include:

* Added a wizard to collect information from the the user
* Provide space templates
fields.summary: Blueprint Support Phase 1
provide an API to refresh the content byline of a page

fields.description:

fields.description:
Confluence Blueprint support for connect addons is very very limited.

There are lots of things broken/missing like:
* createResult view is totally broken, no page title is saved
* you can't put in a description for the blueprint in the create dialog
* the icon for the create dialog is not working
* you can't specify the label put on blueprint pages
* you can't specify the index page title
* dialog wizard support is missing

This means you can do very very little atm.
fields.summary: More Confluence Blueprint support for connect

fields.description:
If your remote macro (both dynamic and static macros will need this) has a body then macro previews in edit mode will not work as expected.

If you are on a new page (or editing a page) and you insert (or edit) a macro, the preview window will call out to the addon to get the preview render.  This may call back in to Confluence to get the body which wont be saved yet. 

If you are on a *new page* the preview will error to the user saying that there is no macro body for the given hash and page id.

If you are *editing a current page*, the preview will display as if the body was not edited (the old body will be loaded).

This is because:
* the state of an edit is only tracked in the user's browser and isn't available on the server (and therefore not available to the addon)
* the page id, and macro hash is calculated by hashing the storage format which isn't saved yet
* the addon receives the page id and hash, and no reference to the current changes
fields.summary: Provide Macro preview for Remote Macros that have a body

The remaining macros to be released before discussing what to do with the obsolete macros are:

* div
* bgcolor
* iframe
* style

These macros all have a large amount of users. Discussing whether we want to batch release them (maybe) could be considered.
fields.summary: Content-Formatting Macros Release Phase 3

fields.description: The confluence content rest api was changed to return a 403 rather than a 404 if the user was not authorized: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/pull-requests/3365/overview. As a result, TestCustomContentDefaultPermission and TestCustomContentRestriction both started failing against the connect confluence snapshot builds because the rest client threw an exception where we were expecting it to return null. The tests were changed as part of ACDEV-3216 to expect either, so the snapshot build and develop build could both be green. When the rest changes reach confluence prod, these tests can be changed to strictly expect an exception, and fail otherwise.
fields.summary: Make Custom Content tests only expect an exception if unauthorized

fields.description:
Hey gang,

Currently it appears there is no way to check if a user can edit the page through Atlassian connect conditions for confluence/

I initially thought this ability existed when I saw *user_logged_in_editable*, but that has to do with password permissions and not page permissions.

Here's the relevant documentation:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/concepts/conditions.html

Thanks,

Mohammed
fields.summary: Check if user can edit Confluence page condition
No way to pass macro parameters to a dialog

fields.description:
I'm having issues with the Synchrony service in Confluence 6.0. How do I temporarily disable it during add-on development?

Disabling the "Synchrony Interop Bootstrap Plugin" doesn't seem to do it - the editor front-end still tries to load synchrony (supposedly) and fails.
fields.summary: Disable Synchrony during development?

fields.description:
Add the JWT filter to capture requests to the Avatar URL to allow JWT authenticated calls to access this resource.

Evolved from:

I am trying to fetch the content of a user avatar image (e.g. https://balsamiq.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/11370508/user-avatar?version=1&modificationDate=1416484775584&api=v2) from an external server and I am redirected to the sign in page.

!Screen Shot 2015-05-27 at 15.08.40.png|thumbnail!

If I try to add a jwt token as a query parameter to the avatar URL I get a 401 error.

Am I missing something?

PS In JIRA you do not need authentication in order to access the avatar URL
fields.summary: Add JWT Filter to Avatar URL

fields.description:
Update [scopes.confluence.json|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/AC/repos/atlassian-connect/browse/plugin/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/connect/confluence/scopes.confluence.json] to include the Confluence Questions REST API. Also include wired tests for the configuration  (following the pattern of {{ConfluenceRestScopesTest}}) or integration tests (following the pattern of {{ReadScopeJiraTest}}).

Each API method needs to be mapped to one of the existing five [scopes used in Confluence|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/scopes/scopes.html]: READ, WRITE, DELETE, SPACE_ADMIN or ADMIN.

Make sure any API method using WebSudo is excluded.

See [Atlassian Connect - Confluence REST Scopes |https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/scopes/confluence-rest-scopes.html] for the current whitelisted API methods in Confluence.
fields.summary: Whitelist REST API endpoints for Confluence Questions

fields.description:
Currently I'm showing a web item on confluence pages and use the content.id to request information back from the Confluence Cloud REST API. When viewing a prior version of the page it returns a different ID that returns a 404 from the REST api.

Need access to the latest version content ID and status so I can request back information about the confluence page.
fields.summary: Context parameter "content.id" doesn't return the same content ID when viewing an older version of the page

fields.summary: QR: Take a look at all the Content Formatting Macros

fields.description: This is a request for an expansion to the Confluence REST API.  In the Java API to update attachments, we have the ability to specify a specific version number regardless of whether it is the next version in the existing order.  This has allowed us to guarantee synchronized versions of multiple attachments in our P2 plugin.  we would like to have the same ability on the cloud version of our plugin.  At present, we have to upload attachments separately, leaving the attachments to fall out of sync with each other if an upload fails.  We would like to be able to specify the version of the attachment when we  PUT a new attachment version as in the Java API call.
fields.summary: Add the ability to specify a version when updating an attachment

fields.description:
In CE-969, we added {{versionOverride}} and {{embeddedContentRender}} as possible query string parameters to the view page url.
The behaviour of these parameters is:
{quote}
* Version Override allows the specifying of a version of the content to render.
* Embedded Content Render specifies whether any embedded content (attachments, page includes etc) should be rendered using the version of the embedded content when the outer page was saved, or the most recent version.{quote}

This issue is to add these parameters as context variables to the Navigator API. Currently, the only way to use them is by directly modifying {{window.top.location}} to send the user to a different page. We want to discourage this at all costs, because the base URL path could change at any time. 

Once this issue is complete, Comalatech will need to move over to using this API instead of {{window.top.location}}.
fields.summary: Add versionOverride and embeddedContentRender parameters to the Navigator API

fields.description:
When trying to expand the container property of a container in the Confluence REST API, the API complains with 'java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot recursively expand : container'.

Example: Retrieve the details of an attachment comment via https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/52901548?expand=container. The expanded container property has a nested container property that I want to expand but calling https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/52901548?expand=container.container does not work.

API returns:
{code}
statusCode": 500,
"message": "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot recursively expand : container"
This should be a legitimate use of the API. The container of an attachment comment is the attachment itself and I want to know which container the attachment is in (e.g. which page).
{code}
 
Another example is a comment on a CQ answer where you would want to expand container multiple times:
{quote}
answer-comment.container = answer
answer-comment.container.container = question
answer-comment.container.container.container = space (or null, for global questions)
{quote}
fields.summary: REST API: Cannot expand multiple container properties
